intro: Zeuxine fluvida, commonly known as the water lily of the marshes, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to wetland habitats in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the genus Zeuxine, which is part of the family Iridaceae, known for its showy flowers. The plant features slender, erect stems with broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often floating or semi-submerged. Its flowers are typically pale blue or white, with three petals and three sepals, and are pollinated by insects. Zeuxine fluvida thrives in shallow water or moist soil, making it an important component of aquatic ecosystems.
